name: mcp-bias-node
description: A local agent for BIAS/MCP-based evidence analysis, anomaly detection, and decentralized truth verification using audit-ready protocols.
long_description: This Desktop Extension turns your machine into a BIAS/MCP trust node—capable of analyzing events, documents, or claims using cutting-edge bias-resistance, evidence mapping, and anomaly detection. The extension enables distributed verification and self-sovereign truth auditing by producing outputs ready for peer review, networking, and long-term archiving. Whether you’re a researcher, journalist, or engaged citizen, you can help strengthen the world’s trust infrastructure with one click.

tools.name: analyze_document
tools.description: Analyze a document using BIAS standards and generate a structured evidence report.

tools.name: detect_bias
tools.description: Scan content for institutional or content bias, conflicts of interest, and anomaly signals.

tools.name: verify_claim
tools.description: Cross-check a factual claim using available open evidence, references, and protocols.

tools.name: evidence_map
tools.description: Visualize and summarize all supporting and contradicting evidence related to a claim—including sources, anomalies, and gaps.

tools.name: summarize_alternatives
tools.description: Display both mainstream and minority perspectives around a topic, highlighting each viewpoint’s supporting data and reasoning.

tools.name: export_report
tools.description: Export structured findings, bias/anomaly reports, or full analysis documents for sharing, audit, or further collaboration.

tools.name: has_needs_status
tools.description: Update and display the investigation’s 'Has/Needs' matrix, tracking available evidence, missing data, and related cases for swarm collaboration.

prompts.name: analyze_document
prompts.description: Analyze any document or text using BIAS/MCP protocols and generate a detailed, bias-aware evidence report.
prompts.text: Please analyze the following document using BIAS/MCP protocols and generate a detailed evidence report: ${arguments.document}

prompts.name: detect_bias
prompts.description: Identify sources of institutional bias, conflicts of interest, or content manipulation in the input.
prompts.text: Identify any institutional bias, content manipulation, or conflicts of interest in this content: ${arguments.content}

prompts.name: verify_claim
prompts.description: Cross-check a factual claim against available evidence and known alternatives to assess plausibility and confidence.
prompts.text: Cross-check the following claim using available evidence and known alternatives: ${arguments.claim}

prompts.name: evidence_map
prompts.description: Visualize and summarize all supporting and contradicting evidence for a claim, including source details, gaps, and anomalies.
prompts.text: Generate a comprehensive map of supporting and contradicting evidence for this claim, including sources and any gaps: ${arguments.claim}

prompts.name: summarize_alternatives
prompts.description: List both mainstream and minority perspectives about a topic, showing reasoning and supporting evidence for each.
prompts.text: List all mainstream and minority perspectives about this topic, with supporting evidence for each: ${arguments.topic}

prompts.name: export_report
prompts.description: Export structured findings, audit summaries, or full analysis documents for sharing or external review.
prompts.text: Export the analysis as a ${arguments.report_type} report suitable for sharing or audit.

prompts.name: has_needs_status
prompts.description: Display or update the Has/Needs matrix, showing what evidence is available and what crucial data is missing.
prompts.text: Display or update the Has/Needs matrix for this investigation: ${arguments.investigation}
